name: BenW
text:
I don't know of a way to do that, but it seems like any "sibling-of" relationship is equivalent to two "child-of" relationships. Could you do something like this instead?

    {
      ?x is-parent-of ?a-child . 
      ?x is-parent-of ?b-child. 
      ?a-child != ?b-child
    }

Or if you're in a position to use [inference rules](https://docs.marklogic.com/guide/semantics/inferencing), you can build a rule that defines "sibling-of" like that. Then although the template doesn't generate "sibling-of" directly, the triples are still tied to the ingested document in the same way as they would be, by virtue of the template generating the "is-parent-of" triples.
